p: This variable also correlates with per capita income on a tribe’s lands and the percent of households on tribal lands that heated their homes with off-grid energy such as wood, coal, coke, kerosene, or other liquid fuels. While the absence of an energy grid may be a rarity in most of the country, 22.5% of Native households on tribal lands heat their homes with wood, coal, coke, kerosene, or other liquid fuels. All three variables are significant, and our key results about technical wind capacity and casino square footage hold (Model 1).
